text.Contract title and description: Client Side Partner - CSP: Building Remediation programme
text.KPI name and description:
Issues and risks management: The Provider will be responsible for operational risk and issue management, will align with DLUHC’s reporting processes, and will escalate issues to the appropriate governance forum. These will be reviewed with owners fortnightly.
The Provider is responsible for ensuring that 
• All live delivery issues and risks must have an appropriate agreed owner, action plan for resolution (unless agreed this is unnecessary), and proposed resolution date.
o The action plan will ensure that the risk’s identified risk level (set by a programme formula) does not grow in the following month: unless this is outside of the Provider or Programme’s control and the danger of the risk’s growth has been appropriately escalated.
• All issues and risks, including buildings which are identified as out of tolerance, should have an identified risk and issue code and a corresponding action or mitigation plan within 10 working days unless the programme agrees otherwise.
This applies to commercial and market capacity risks and should also link to activities identified within the Plan on a Page
text.Good target: Zero quality issues raised by the authority against the criteria outlined in the KPI.

text.Comments: Profiled KPI targets increased significantly this quarter but there has not been a corresponding uplift in teachers completing 5 hours of CPD. This is mainly due to ongoing challenges with teacher capacity and classroom release. As a result there has been a preference for attending shorter courses which require multiple engagements over the year for a teacher to reach trained. Computing Hubs are scheduling sequences of courses to  ensure more teachers will reach 'trained' over the course of the academic year.  The DfE team will be looking at reshaping this KPI to reflect the inability of teachers to attend CPD during school hours.

text.Contract title and description: RECRUITING PARTNERING CONTRACT-HQLF2/1739
text.KPI name and description: Recruitment of Regular Soldiers: Demand/Baseline Recruit Allocation Plan percentage
text.Comments: KPI 1 reflects Capita’s performance in recruiting soldiers to meet specific monthly targets across a wide range of job roles. With regards KPI 1, the contractor’s ability to achieve recruitment targets during Q3 has been impacted by the ongoing buoyant National jobs market that shows a high vacancy rate, with job postings significantly above pre-pandemic levels, which means that Capita with the Army offer is competing against many other potential employers to attract recruits to fill these vacancies, whilst at the same time there has been a reduction in the size of the eligible target audience due to changing social demographics and cultural shifts. To address these challenges, Capita is working closely with the Army to drive a number of initiatives seeking to increase overall volumes and further improve conversion rates; these include optimisation of current marketing activities to maximise engagement with main target audiences & generally raise the profile of the Army as an attractive job choice.

text.Contract title and description: BATUK Aviation - Lot One MEDEVAC
text.KPI name and description: Ground Ambulance – Helicopter Landing Site (HLS) Response. The Supplier shall ensure one available and reliable ground ambulance is available 24/7/365. To be deemed available and reliable the ground ambulance shall meet the response times as per the Statement of Requirement (SoR) and be situated at the designated landing site ready to conduct takeover of the patient from the air MEDEVAC platform to the Aga Khan Hospital, be suitably equipped and configured to continue patient care with a communication system as per the SoR, be manned by a minimum of one qualified person in pre emergency care to Level 5, be able to transfer the patient and continue care in the correct configuration, be a fully serviceable ground ambulance maintained and operated within Kenyan Road Transport Regulations and be driven by a competent driver backed up with a trained mechanic and despatch team.
text.Good target: The ground ambulance is at the Helicopter Landing Site (HLS) to meet the air MEDEVAC platform and successfully hands over the patient as confirmed by the Medical Liaison Officer.
